title: Senior Director of Finance
description:
Company Overview

Built is a growth-stage company at the intersection of FinTech and PropTech. We are on a mission to change the way the world gets built with technology and services that streamline the $1.4T U.S. construction industry.

Built’s platform for the construction finance industry modernizes the movement of money between all stakeholders within the construction and real estate process to manage risk and maximize productivity. Built provides software, payments, B2B marketplace, and data solutions to more than 190 of the top financial institutions and hundreds of contractors throughout North America.

In addition to our recent $125M Series D funding and $1.5B valuation, we’re proud to have been named one of Forbes’ Best Startup Employers in America and one of The Tennessean’s 2022 Top Workplaces . Bringing on the “best talent in the world” is at the forefront of our continued growth trajectory—and we want you to be part of it.

LINKS

 Series D Financing Round  Built Upon 2021 Success 

Role Summary

We are seeking an experienced finance leader to join Built as the Senior Director of Finance, reporting to Built’s CFO and responsible for all aspects of financial reporting, financial planning and analysis (FP&A), operational and strategic decision support, maintaining Built’s long-range plan, and building a world-class Finance practice at Built. This role is crucial in providing strategic insights and financial guidance to support our company's growth objectives. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of financial modeling, budgeting, forecasting, and analysis, coupled with a strategic mindset, an acute understanding of how to drive change through a people-first leadership style, a tenacious pursuit of excellence, and high responsibility as a key partner to the CEO, executive team, and broader business.

In This Role You Will

Financial Planning & Analysis: providing strategic direction and oversight for all financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and analysis activities. Develop and maintain sophisticated financial models to support decision-making by executive leadership and the board of directors.Financial Reporting: Ensure the accurate and timely preparation of financial statements and reports, including profit and loss, balance sheet, and cash flow statements. Implement best practices in financial reporting to enhance transparency and compliance with relevant accounting standards and regulations.Decision Support: Act as a strategic advisor to business units and functional leaders, offering insights and analysis to support operational efficiency and strategic initiatives. Conduct in-depth financial analysis to identify opportunities for cost savings, revenue enhancement, and process improvements. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align financial planning with operational strategies.Strategic Finance: Serve as a key advisor to the CFO and executive team on financial matters, contributing to the formulation of corporate strategy and financial objectives, including organic and inorganic growth.Capital Allocation: Lead the development and execution of the annual budget, working closely with department heads to ensure alignment with strategic objectives. Embed frugality and world-class resource allocation as a cultural and operational norm through monthly budget variance analysis and supporting leaders as they manage tradeoffs in resource allocation.Forecasting and Scenario Analysis: Conduct monthly and quarterly forecasting to project financial outcomes based on current and anticipated business activities. Develop scenario analysis models to evaluate the financial impact of strategic decisions, macroeconomic conditions, initiative performance, and operational tradeoffs.Financial Reporting and Analysis: Oversee the generation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, providing analysis and insights on key performance indicators (KPIs), financial trends, and business drivers. Ensure stakeholders have the information needed to make informed decisions.Building a World-Class Finance Function: Champion the transformation of the FP&A function into a world-class finance team. Implement leading-edge financial systems, processes, and analytics tools to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and strategic insight. Foster a culture of continuous improvement, innovation, and professional development within the finance team.Board and Investor Communications: Lead the preparation and presentation of financial reports for board meetings and investor updates. Articulate financial strategies, performance, and forecasts effectively to ensure understanding and support from external stakeholders.Mentorship and Team Development: Mentor and develop the FP&A team, fostering a culture of high performance, continuous improvement, and professional growth. Ensure the team possesses the skills, knowledge, and motivation to support the organization's financial and strategic objectives.

Who You Are

Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field.Demonstrated expertise in financial planning and analysis, in a leadership role and preferably within a high-growth enterprise software or technology company.Preferred prior experience in investment banking, venture capital/private equity, or related fields.Proven track record of developing financial strategies, building financial models, and leading budgeting and forecasting processes.Deep understanding of how to connect operational components to financial outcomes, both mechanistically within reporting, forecasting, and decision making, as well as connectivity between teams within an organization.Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights.Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the capability to convey financial concepts to non-financial stakeholders.Strong management skills, including process and project management, managing deliverables across multiple constituencies.

Built’s salary range for this position is $225,000-$270,000 USD per year. The pay range is designed to accommodate upward mobility in the role, therefore it encompasses the full span of proficiency levels for this role and we believe that the midpoint of the range is competitive in the market. Salary is just one component of Built's total compensation package for employees. Your total rewards package at Built will include equity, top-notch medical, dental and vision coverage, an unlimited PTO policy, and other benefits.

Perks

 The rare opportunity to radically disrupt an industry  Competitive benefits including: uncapped vacation, health, dental & vision insurance, and 401k  Robust compensation package including base salary and equity  Flexible working hours, paid family leave, ERGs & Mentorship opportunities  Learning grant program to support ongoing professional development 

Our company is made up of passionate people who are driven in a variety of disciplines—and each of them brings their unique perspective to everything they do. Creating a safe and inclusive workplace is critical to the success of our company and of our employees, so it’s our aim to recruit, hire and promote without bias against race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law. As we learn and as we grow, we’re committed to ensuring that these ideals are at the forefront of everything we do.

title: Research Technologist
description:
Job Req ID: 113433

Research Technologist

The Department of Pediatrics' Allergy and Immunology Division is currently seeking a Research Technologist to contribute to several multidisciplinary clinical studies focused on food allergies in children. The position entails the collection and processing of various biological specimens, including blood, urine, stool, saliva, skin, and nasal fluids from patients. Primary responsibilities include collecting biological specimens from patients and ensuring proper processing in the laboratory. Utilizing techniques to isolate plasma, serum, basophils, and peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) from blood samples, as well as various cell types from nasal lavage samples. Conducting assays to assess basophil activation. Properly labeling, logging, and maintaining inventory of specimens, and managing databases accordingly. Packaging specimens in specialized containers for shipment to designated processing sites.

Additionally, the role involves participation in research related to environmental allergens, specifically the analysis of household dust samples for common allergens such as mouse, cat, dog, cockroach, and dust mite. This entails receiving dust samples collected using airborne sampling devices and preparing them for analysis. Performing ELISA assays to quantify allergen levels. Utilizing the SOFTmax Pro program for ELISA data analysis, followed by further analysis and data entry into Excel.

Other duties include ordering supplies necessary for laboratory operations. Preparing buffers and maintaining records. General laboratory maintenance to ensure a clean and functional work environment.

Specific Duties & Responsibilities

This description is a general statement of required duties and responsibilities performed on a regular and continuous basis. It does not exclude other duties as assigned:

Use basic science knowledge to learn techniques/methods of the lab.Perform laboratory tasks and complete routine assays following common or established protocols and procedures.Will handle bio-hazardous material under Biosafety Level 2 conditions.Gain problem solving skills through progressive training, understanding of the research and experience.Understand the role of senior lab members and accepts constructive guidance.Interact with faculty, lab and administrative staff, students, postdoctoral fellows, and outside vendors.Increase own skill base and knowledge of lab research and relevant assays.Train users in standard equipment operation and routine lab techniques and procedures.Collect project data, organize/collate and analyze data.Recommends revisions to experimental methods based upon observations of the data.Prepare, test, and maintain standard laboratory equipment.Perform related laboratory maintenance, participate in cleaning rotation of common laboratory space/equipment and monitor inventory of supplies.Demonstrate organization, curiosity, problem solving, resourcefulness, and flexibility.


Special Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities

 Working knowledge of GCLP, CAP, CLIA regulations and CLSI procedure formats applicable to a clinical lab.Strong working knowledge of computers, skilled in Microsoft Office Word, Excel, file organization, and internet research.Must be able to work successfully as part of a team in a high volume, dynamic laboratory.Must have the ability to read and interpret direction, both oral and written, organize and prioritize work and follow through on assignments.Individual should have strong written communication and interpersonal skills.Uses various software applications, such as spreadsheets, relational databases, electronic mail and World Wide Web. Work requires precision and attention to detail.


Physical Requirements

While performing the duties of this job, the employee may remain in a stationary position (sitting or standing) up to 75% of the time.Occasionally required to traverse throughout the laboratory or to retrieve equipment, supplies, or specimens from other locations on campus.The employee is required to operate computer keyboard, laboratory instruments and small laboratory tools such as pipettes, cutting instruments, glass tubes, dishes, and/or slides. Constantly repositions self to perform duties at laboratory workstations, gathering specimens, and loading equipment.Prolonged vision requirements include viewing computer screen, paper reports/documents, charts and results. Visual acuity is required to distinguish fine gradation of color or structure and closely examine specimens (including via a microscope).


Laboratory Environment

 Exposure to toxins and infectious agents exist, but potential for personal injury or harm is minimized if established safety and health precautions are followed.  Must refer to and are expected to comply with procedures and be familiar with material data safety sheets in assigned work areas. Able to read and understand all Health, Safety and Environment (HSE) guidelines applicable to assigned work area. Working in laboratory where there may be discomforts due to odors, noise, temperature fluctuations, and working around lab equipment.  Research areas may include animal, human, human products, DNA, and radiation protocols. Use of personal protective equipment may be advised or required. May transport equipment and supplies usually less than 40 pounds from one area to another (in the laboratory). In some areas workspace is limited.


Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Biology, Chemistry, or related field.


Preferred Qualifications

Some related post-graduate work experience preferred.

title: ITS Engineer
description:
TYLin is a globally recognized, full-service infrastructure consulting firm committed to providing innovative, cost-effective, constructible designs for the global infrastructure market. With over 3,000 employees throughout the Americas, Asia, and Europe, the firm provides support on projects of varying size and complexity. Job Summary

TYLin City Solutions is looking for an Intelligent Transportations Systems (ITS) Engineer to join our Philadelphia based team. We are seeking an experienced and self-motivated professional who has experience working with state DOTs and other local/ federal agencies.

TYLin City Solutions projects involve the design of ITS systems such as CCTV cameras, Variable Message Signs, Count stations, Fiber Communication, Transit Signal Priority, Traffic Signal Design and Traffic Management Center for domestic and international projects. Projects often involve concept of operation (ConOps), conceptual design, final design, and preparation of construction drawings for ITS Systems. These projects require a thorough understanding of transportation engineering and ITS with construction support activities, smart mobility, connected vehicles and emerging technologies to support transportation infrastructure.

Assist senior-level staff in planning, designing, and implementing technology solutions for transportation issues. Assist with projects related to ITS program management and oversight, Transportation Systems Management and Operations (TSM&O), Advanced Transportation Management Systems (ATMS), Transportation Management Centers (TMC), Advanced Traveler Information Systems (ATIS), Managed Lanes, Automated Connected Electric and Shared (ACES) vehicle technologies, and associated performance measures. Design of central/field communications, traffic control equipment, communications devices, traffic controller hardware and software, transit signal priority, CCTV cameras, DMS, traffic detectors, and electronic tolling equipment. Assist in the development of ITS infrastructure, traffic signal, and integration of traffic control systems. Assist in managing the fiber-optic traffic signal communications network, CCTV system, developing standard operating procedures for server data backups. Address technical questions/issues. Ensure the quality and timeliness of project deliverables. Prepare technical proposals. 

Required Qualifications

BS or MS degree in Electrical, Civil, or other related Engineering fieldsMust have 3 – 6 years of experience working on related technology-based projectsFamiliar with System Engineering, ConOps and ITS standards

Familiarity in signal timing, ATSPMs, and adaptive traffic control systemsExperience working with state DOTs, and other local agenciesRegistered Professional Engineer, preferably in PA, NJ, NY, DC, MD, or VA. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in Computer-Aided Design (CAD) software

TYLin offers a comprehensive total rewards package. Our benefits include extensive medical, disability and life insurance coverage, continuing education benefits, paid time off, employee assistance program and a retirement savings plan with company matching contributions.

We encourage all candidates to explore our total rewards offering.

The company and its employees are required to comply with all local health authority, legal or lawful client requirements.

This position requires cross-functional collaboration in the strategic development and execution of internal communications programs to drive employee engagement for Golden 1 and provide communications support through partnerships with ED&C, HR, CCR, Marketing, and revenue generating business lines.

The Director will additionally evaluate and analyze insights and learnings to define benchmarks and maximize return on objectives, recommending improvements and innovations through regular, constructive dialogue with senior leadership and colleagues within and outside the department.

Tasks, Duties, Functions

 Serve on the department leadership team, working with other department leaders and teams to help create and execute an integrated enterprise communications and development strategy.  Manage, identify, develop, and evaluate strategies that ensure our enterprise communications initiatives exemplify Golden 1 Credit Union’s culture, vision, and strategic priorities.  Establish and track metrics that help correlate enterprise communications programs to employee engagement and organization performance.  Represent the voice of the employee to leadership and reflect employee voice in messaging.  Provide direct communications support to executive and senior leadership and collaborate with cross-functional team leaders to coordinate project communications and messages that enhance their internal presence and contribute to the achievement of project goals.  Maintain visibility to enterprise-wide initiatives across business lines to identify, develop, and evaluate areas for leveraging, improving, and innovating enterprise communications.  Partner with HR in the development of strategies and execution of tactics for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion.  Oversee and optimize all employee communications, including emails, newsletters and announcements that keep employees informed about relevant news and information.  Build and execute communications to support Golden 1 culture, focused on the core principles that make our culture strong and unique.  Manage content on G1 Insiders and ensure all materials are aligned with company priorities and communication strategy.  Meet deadlines, prioritize communication requests, and maintain strong attention to detail to ensure consistency and quality.  Research and write Board, Committee, and C-level reports, as well as attend meetings as necessary, ensuring timely delivery to all stakeholders; edit and develop content for the monthly report.  Assist and support the VP - Enterprise Development and Communications with development of annual and ongoing strategy and budgets, planning, coordination, and implementation of programs and initiatives.  Manage annual budget for the Enterprise Communications department.  Develop and maintain relationships with external vendors.  Maintain a thorough understanding of state and federal laws and regulations related to credit union compliance including bank secrecy and anti-money laundering laws appropriate to the position.  Develop and maintain an understanding of the pertinent regulatory requirements and risks inherent to job responsibilities, establish, and maintain control activities that mitigate those risks consistent with the Credit Union’s risk appetite, and ensure operational integrity and compliance with applicable regulations.  Other duties as assigned. 

 PHYSICAL SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND EXERTION UTILIZED IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THESE TASK: 

 Exceptional research skills with strong ability to analyze and present data to inform and influence business decisions.  Strong, effective, and persuasive business writing skills, from generating reports to creating presentations.  Effective oral and presentation skills required.  Must possess sufficient manual dexterity to skillfully operate an on-line computer terminal and other standard office equipment, such as financial calculators, personal computer, facsimile machine, and telephone.  Excellent oral and written communication skills required to consistently deliver a clear and consistent message to Golden 1 employees. 

Organizational Contacts & Relationships

 INTERNAL: All levels of staff and management  EXTERNAL: Members, Potential Members, Potential Employees, Vendors, Community Leaders, 3rd party vendors, other credit union representatives. 

Qualifications

 EDUCATION:  Bachelor’s degree in communications, journalism, public relations, or a related field required.

 EXPERIENCE:  Minimum 15 years of experience in communications, marketing, and/or corporate affairs with emphasis on developing and managing communications programs. Experience building partnerships and relationships within the organization. Experience in communications campaign practices and programming. Strategic planning with enterprise mindset required.

 KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:  Knowledge of corporate communications practices and trends. Strong work ethic with a passion to advocate and serve internal audiences. Detail-oriented, with strong leadership, project management, and organizational skills. Strong writing skills. Self-starter attitude and can work independently and as part of a larger team. Excellent interpersonal, communication, and analytical skills. Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.

Licenses / Certifications

A valid California Driver’s License is required.

title: FMS Analyst IV
description:
Overview

Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center is an independent, nonprofit organization providing adult cancer treatment and groundbreaking research focused on cancer and infectious diseases. Based in Seattle, Fred Hutch is the only National Cancer Institute-designated cancer center in Washington.

With a track record of global leadership in bone marrow transplantation, HIV/AIDS prevention, immunotherapy and COVID-19 vaccines, Fred Hutch has earned a reputation as one of the world’s leading cancer, infectious disease and biomedical research centers. Fred Hutch operates eight clinical care sites that provide medical oncology, infusion, radiation, proton therapy and related services, and network affiliations with hospitals in five states. Together, our fully integrated research and clinical care teams seek to discover new cures to the world’s deadliest diseases and make life beyond cancer a reality.

At Fred Hutch we value collaboration, compassion, determination, excellence, innovation, integrity and respect. These values are grounded in and expressed through the principles of diversity, equity and inclusion. Our mission is directly tied to the humanity, dignity and inherent value of each employee, patient, community member and supporter. Our commitment to learning across our differences and similarities make us stronger. We seek employees who bring different and innovative ways of seeing the world and solving problems. Fred Hutch is in pursuit of becoming an anti-racist organization. We are committed to ensuring that all candidates hired share our commitment to diversity, anti-racism and inclusion.

The Financial Management Systems Analyst IV supports Fred Hutch’s Oracle PeopleSoft Financial (FMS) and Supply Chain Management (SCM) application. The scope of the role includes a broad range of activities including production/customer support, developing functional specifications, functional systems design and development, prototyping, testing, documentation, participation in PeopleTools and PeopleSoft PUM updates, all while delivering solutions and best practice business process improvements. The Analyst will support the needs of the Finance, Accounting and AR/Billing groups, Procurement and Accounts Payable utilizing PeopleSoft Financials and Supply Chain expertise to collaboratively solve problems and design solutions across applicable module(s) and across other Finance applications, as needed. Other applications supported by FMIS include PBCS, Onbase, AnyDoc, Jaggaer, Huron Grants, and WebFocus.

At Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center, all employees are expected to demonstrate a commitment to our values of collaboration, compassion, determination, excellence, innovation, integrity, and respect.

Responsibilities

Provide leadership in the evaluation, conceptualization, design, and development of new capabilities across FSCM modules.Own the “life cycle” of the FSCM modules and related production issues from identification, research, workaround/root cause resolution to communication with end user.Align with Customer groups to interpret internal business challenges and pain points and recommend best practices and technology solutions to improve applications, processes, or services.Work with business analysts, business users and subject matter experts to analyze, define, and document functional specifications to support operational activities across the Finance division.Design and document test strategies, plans and scripting; execute testing and guide business partners in testing execution.Proactively support Finance customers in the use of PeopleSoft Financials across implemented modules, recommending solutions to finance business problems.Mentor other analysts in frameworks and methodologies used by Business Systems Analysts to deliver business value to our customers.Build cross team collaboration to produce high-quality work products.Manage business expectations and deliver customer-focused solutions.Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Minimum seven years’ experience with PeopleSoft FSCM including deep knowledge of delivered features and functionality across all modules.PeopleTools v8.56 or greater and PeopleSoft Financials 9.2 with PUM update experience.Experience developing functional specifications.Experience facilitating meetings to translate abstract concepts into tangible solutions.Proven experience bridging the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders.

A statement describing your commitment and contributions toward greater diversity, equity, inclusion, and antiracism in your career or that will be made through your work at Fred Hutch is requested of all finalists.

This role will have the opportunity to work remotely and also partially at our campus.

The annual base salary range for this position is from $109,637 to $173,264, and pay offered will be based on experience and qualifications.

Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center offers employees a comprehensive benefits package designed to enhance health, well-being, and financial security. Benefits include medical/vision, dental, flexible spending accounts, life, disability, retirement, family life support, employee assistance program, onsite health clinic, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation (12-22 days per year), paid sick leave (12-25 days per year), paid holidays (13 days per year), paid parental leave (up to 4 weeks), and partially paid sabbatical leave (up to 6 months).

Our Commitment to Diversity

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA) Employer. We are committed to cultivating a workplace in which diverse perspectives and experiences are welcomed and respected. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, ancestry, national origin, sex, age, disability (physical or mental), marital or veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, political ideology, or membership in any other legally protected class. We are an Affirmative Action employer. We encourage individuals with diverse backgrounds to apply and desire priority referrals of protected veterans. If due to a disability you need assistance/and or a reasonable accommodation during the application or recruiting process, please send a request to Human Resources at hrops@fredhutch.org or by calling 206-667-4700.

Located just 45 minutes north of Denver, Northern Colorado offers trendy restaurants, a thriving retail sector, and endless cultural amenities. Between wildflower-filled meadows and spectacular views of the Rocky Mountains, you will find adventures by horse, mountain bike and boat plus, endless hiking trails and world class skiing.

The Banner Home Medical Equipment (HME) department is looking for an HME tech to join their dynamic team! In this role you will be responsible for delivering Medical Equipment and setting patients up with new equipment on daily route days as well as assist with warehouse activity including cleaning equipment, helping with inventory projects and other warehouse activities on non-route days.

This is a full time 40 hour per week position working Monday – Friday from 9:30am - 5:30pm. On-call is required with this position which includes on-call compensation. If you are someone that is interested in serving the community with the best customer service and home medical equipment, apply today!

Position Summary

This position provides service to Home Care patients through delivery, assembly, and instruction on safe use, follow-up visits, and on-call trouble shooting of home medical equipment. Completes daily logging, documentation, and follow-up on medical equipment and patients following all company policies and regulatory requirements. Participates in cleaning, testing, troubleshooting and preventive maintenance of medical equipment following manufacture guidelines and company policy.

Core Functions

 Loads, delivers, sets up and provides operational instructions, education and troubleshooting material with patient/caregiver on use of home medical equipment including but not limited to Oxygen, Pediatric oxygen, NPWT, Enteral, and bedroom/bathroom medical equipment and associated supplies, in accordance with company policy and regulatory requirements. May also assist with internal and external loan closet replenishment.  Completes required documentation associated with equipment pick-ups and equipment delivery, set up, instruction and education of products in accordance with company policy, state and federal regulatory requirements.  Responds to emergency delivery calls on a regular basis and participates in the on call troubleshooting and delivery rotation.  Clean and disinfect medical equipment. Inspects tests and performs equipment preventive maintenance to ensure proper operating condition according to manufacturer's guidelines and company policy.  Completes annual competencies of all products to ensure knowledge of current standards.  Helps to ensures delivery vehicle is in proper working condition by use of daily vehicle inspection. Maintains accurate daily vehicle inspection, inventory and route logs.  May have responsibility for operation and maintenance of the oxygen cylinder transfill station and warehouse functions.  Works independently on-site with patients and family members. Prioritizes work to balance patient satisfaction and company resources. Internal customers include staff, physicians and patients. External customers include vendors, physician office staff and family members. 

Minimum Qualifications

High school diploma/GED or equivalent working knowledge.

Must possess a valid driver’s license and be eligible for coverage under the company auto insurance policy. In some locations, CDL with appropriate Hazardous Materials certification may be required.

One year of experience in hospital, home care, HME, transportation or other healthcare related setting. Must demonstrate excellent face-to-face customer service. Ability to meet the physical demands of the position. Employees working for Banner Home Care/Hospice must possess an Arizona Fingerprint Clearance Card at the time of hire and maintain the card for the duration of their employment.

Ability to keep detailed records regarding equipment and medical records. Ability to communicate effectively. Able to prioritize and organize daily work according to patient needs.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in equipment maintenance and repair and knowledge of local delivery area is preferred.

Additional Related Education And/or Experience Preferred.
